doc.str: This metadata record describes bottom-mounted ADCP data collected at Point Sal, California, USA, by PISCO. Measurements were collected using an RDI 600 kHz Workhorse Sentinel ADCP beginning 2003-09-02. The instrument depth was 015 meters, in an overall water depth of 15 meters (both relative to Mean Sea Level, MSL). The instrument was programmed with a sampling interval of 2.0 minutes and a vertical resolution of 1 meter.

arr.name: keywords
arr.str: EARTH SCIENCE: Oceans: Ocean Circulation: Ocean Currents
EARTH SCIENCE: Oceans: Ocean Temperature: Water Temperature
EARTH SCIENCE: Oceans: Ocean Pressure: Pressure

doc.str: PISCO: Physical Oceanography: bottom-mounted ADCP data: Point Sal, California, USA (PTS)
Partnership for Interdisciplinary Studies of Coastal Oceans (PISCO)

arr.name: site
arr.str: Point Sal: PTS: The nearshore mooring is located approximately 5 km Southeast of Point Sal, California, USA. The base of the mooring is in 15 meters of water below Mean Sea Level (MSL), and it extends up to 4 meters below MSL. The altitudeMinimum and altitudeMaximum tags in this initial coverage section refer to the ADCP measurement range and are also referenced to MSL. They do not represent the overall water depth. Note the nominal range of the ADCP may extend from near-bottom (a depth expressed as a negative altitude) to slightly above MSL (a height expressed as a positive altitude).

arr.name: origin
arr.str: Partnership for Interdisciplinary Studies of Coastal Oceans (PISCO)

arr.name: contactOrganization
arr.str: Partnership for Interdisciplinary Studies of Coastal Oceans (PISCO)

arr.name: attributeDescription
arr.str: Greenwich Mean Time calendar date of each ADCP measurement record, using ISO 8601 standard format YYYY-MM-DD

Greenwich Mean Time of each ADCP measurement record, to the 1/100th of a second, using ISO 8601 standard format hh:mm:ss.ssZ. The 'Z' indicates 'Zero Meridian' (or Greenwich Mean Time) and must be included.

Greenwich Mean Time of each ADCP measurement record, expressed as fractional decimal days since Jan. 1 of the year measurement was made. For example, 12 noon GMT on Jan. 2 is represented by yearday 1.5, NOT yearday 2.5.
The height of the velocity, temperature, or pressure measurement, in meters above the sea bottom.
The depth of the velocity, temperature, or pressure measurement, in positive meters below Mean Sea Level (MSL). Bins above MSL are represented with negative depths.

The fluctuating water depth (sea floor to sea surface distance) at the measurement site, in meters, as determined by location of sea surface from ADCP pressure measurements, or if pressure is unavailable, the maximum in ADCP echo intensity.
pressure measured at the ADCP sensor, measured in decibars with a precision defined as the effective resolution of the instrument.
ADCP echo intensity (or backscatter), in RDI counts. This value represents the average of all 4 beams, rounded to the nearest whole number.

A post-processing quantitative data quality indicator. Specifically, RDI percent-good #4, in earth coordinates (percentage of successful 4-beam transformations), expressed as a percentage, 50, 80, 95, etc.
True eastward velocity measurements. Negative values represent westward velocities.
True northward velocity measurements. Negative values represent southward velocities.
True upwards velocity measurements. Negative values represent downward velocities.
The difference of two vertical velocities, each measured by an opposing pair of ADCP beams
data flag used to qualify data as bad, questionable, etc.

arr.name: attribute
arr.str: date Greenwich Mean Time calendar date of each ADCP measurement record, using ISO 8601 standard format YYYY-MM-DD

time Greenwich Mean Time of each ADCP measurement record, to the 1/100th of a second, using ISO 8601 standard format hh:mm:ss.ssZ. The 'Z' indicates 'Zero Meridian' (or Greenwich Mean Time) and must be included.

yearday Greenwich Mean Time of each ADCP measurement record, expressed as fractional decimal days since Jan. 1 of the year measurement was made. For example, 12 noon GMT on Jan. 2 is represented by yearday 1.5, NOT yearday 2.5. nominalDay
height The height of the velocity, temperature, or pressure measurement, in meters above the sea bottom. meter
depth The depth of the velocity, temperature, or pressure measurement, in positive meters below Mean Sea Level (MSL). Bins above MSL are represented with negative depths. meter

waterdepth The fluctuating water depth (sea floor to sea surface distance) at the measurement site, in meters, as determined by location of sea surface from ADCP pressure measurements, or if pressure is unavailable, the maximum in ADCP echo intensity. meter
temp_c seawater temperature from ADCP sensor celsius
pressure pressure measured at the ADCP sensor, measured in decibars with a precision defined as the effective resolution of the instrument. decibar
intensity ADCP echo intensity (or backscatter), in RDI counts. This value represents the average of all 4 beams, rounded to the nearest whole number. number

data_quality A post-processing quantitative data quality indicator. Specifically, RDI percent-good #4, in earth coordinates (percentage of successful 4-beam transformations), expressed as a percentage, 50, 80, 95, etc. number
eastward True eastward velocity measurements. Negative values represent westward velocities. metersPerSecond
northward True northward velocity measurements. Negative values represent southward velocities. metersPerSecond
upwards True upwards velocity measurements. Negative values represent downward velocities. metersPerSecond
errorvelocity The difference of two vertical velocities, each measured by an opposing pair of ADCP beams metersPerSecond
flag data flag used to qualify data as bad, questionable, etc.
